medical_history.chief_complaint: Difficulty driving in low light levels and distorted central vision.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The proband from Family 1, a 43-year-old female, experienced mild symptoms initially. Her visual acuities decreased from 20/20 to 20/30 bilaterally over five months. In Family 2, a 43-year-old male reported distortion in right eye vision with stable visual acuity of 20/17 bilaterally but decreased to 20/60 and 20/30 after 18 years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Medical history includes asthma, Vitamin D deficiency, thyroid cancer, postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome, and hypermobility.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes maternal grandfather with 'tunnel vision' and maternal grandmother diagnosed with macular degeneration.
